pages.text: $(li)The Redstone Comparator that is used to maintain, compare, subtract signal strength, or to measure certain block states.
$(li)A Redstone Comparator with no powered sides outputs the same signal strength as its rear input.
$(li)A Redstone Comparator in comparison mode (front torch unpowered) compares its rear input to its two side inputs.
$(li)If either side input is greater than the rear input, the comparator output turns off.
$(li)If neither side input is greater than the rear input, the comparator outputs the same signal strength as its rear input.
$(li)A Redstone Comparator in subtraction mode subtracts the signal strength of the higher side input from the signal strength of the rear input.
$(li)A Redstone Comparator treats certain blocks behind it as power sources and outputs a signal strength proportional to the block's state.
$(li)A redstone comparator can output a signal indicating how full a container is. The strenght varies from 0 to 15 depending on how full it is.
